Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-Shot T90 vs Canon Power Shot SD780IS
Reviews.Author: Kimmy
Reviews.Content: Before I conducted this side by side comparison, I purchased and returned the Olympus Tough 6000, Casio EX FC-100 and Casio Exilim EX-S10.  The Olympus took awful pictures. The S10 was just blah - no real feature improvements of the Exilim 5MP I have now. The FC-100 was just too big.So yes, I am picky!  I wanted a small, sexy, functioning, easy to use, superior camera.  I was torn between the Canon Powershot 780IS and Sony Cyber-Shot T90.  I visited with both at a retail store and was still undecided - besides Amazon prices were much cheaper.  I ordered both and did a side by side comparison in my home. The Canon went back - sorry Powershot.Here's the scoop. Just for base leveling - I just like to take good pictures of my dogs and garden and husband and just life. I'm not a professional. I mostly post my pictures facebook or email - very rarely do I print.Both cameras were sexy and small.  Both were hefty and felt solid.  Both require you remove the battery to charge it.  That's about where the similarities end.The Canon menu interface was clunky and not intuitive.  I have not used either brand of camera in the past - so I have no bias from previous experience.  Simple things like changing the picture setting took a couple minutes to figure out.  The Sony has a touch screen - which at first I thought was just hype.  I mean really, Ashton is cute and all - but I don't need a touch screen. Then I used it!! It rocks!! Very easy to navigate. Quick to learn and very functional. The T90 is almost completely automatic.  The only feature missing is the "make me look skinny" setting. Plus in auto mode - the camera tells you which setting is selected (portrait, landscape, gourmet food- seriously).  So you don't have to worry if your mountains will look like sushi or vice versa.  The smile detection comes on automatically when you take a picture of a face.  It's doesn't work on dogs - but it did recognize a Barbie doll face. There are tons of features - like touching the screen to focus on a person or object for the auto focus.  Smile settings - little smile, medium, and big. The screen is a nice size for viewing and sharing on the spot.  And seriously, it has a gourmet food setting. I have no idea why- but it's cool. There is also a beach setting, snow setting and underwater setting (camera is not waterproof).The big deal breaker was the picture quality. I took at picture of the same scenes with both cameras at the same time. Both camera set to auto setting and then set to landscape.  I uploaded all pictures to my laptop and viewed them in the format and size directly from the camera. The Sony pictures were more vibrant, had more detail and were crisp.  I asked my husband to look at a side by side of the pictures - he picked the Sony pictures, as well.  I also tested the image stabilization on both cameras. The Sony again was superior.  Neither camera did well when I jumped up a down while taking a shot. But, the Sony outperformed on hand wobbling.  So, done!!  The Sony won.The Sony also has less shutter lag and shorter "boot up time".  I love the touch screen.  The camera is small, easy to use and fun. The picture quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Let me take a moment to gush over my T90
Reviews.Author: D. Campbell
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera since Tuesday and it's Friday and I'm still amazed. I've spent hours trying to learn my way around the menu, taking pictures, recording videos. I previously owned the Sony W150, but I upgraded for something much smaller. I've used the Panasonic Lumix and I've tried different Canon cameras, but the T90 takes the cake. This camera is sleek! The black casing is sexy :). I've tried all the Rec modes, except landscape. I still need to try the 6 scene selection modes. Overall, The photos are beautiful. The intelligent scene recognition mode is truly amazing. I tried to simulate several scenes in my living room/ kitchen with the windows open or closed, lights on or off. The camera was able to clearly identify the scene, backlight, or even when I simply desired to take a macro shot of my fingers to see all the wrinkles(unbelievable what scene recognition does)! As of now, I am happy and I have no regrets with my purchase. The battery does not last as long as my Sony W150, but it's good enough. I also picked up the Sony infolithium battery on here for like $38 (bought it through Amazon for peace of mind). I also purchased the 8gb MS Pro Duo Mark2 through Amazon for $44. Best Buy is selling the 8gb Mark 2 for $39.99 on sale right now until 5/2 (I wish I purchased it through BB, but it's only five dollars so whatever). I also purchased my camera through Best Buy for $299.99 plus tax (If only I would have checked Amazon's pricing before buying). Well despite all of that, the camera is absolutely wonderful. The honeymoon phase is going great and I would definitely recommend it to anyone. Hopefully, months from now I'm still happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: I have big cameras for great shots, but I needed a small camera that could still get great shots.
Reviews.Author: Tony Ramos "NewLondon"
Reviews.Content: In short, I love travel.  I always have at least two cameras with me.  But I needed a camera for those times that I didn't want to look like a tourist, but I still wanted great photos.  You know, those dress-up events and such.  Or even those wonderful photo oportunities that you may stumble upon.  This camera covered the need precisely.  It has some features that even my larger cameras don't have like Face Detection.  My only real advice to anyone who buys the camera is that you ALWAYS use the hand strap.  This is a tiny camera that has a touch sensive screen with many buttons on the camera's edges.  So you have to gingerly hold it and it may slip from such a grip.  Otherwise, this is a GREAT camera that can fit into a pocket.  But do get the Sony brand carry case.  You can use it or leave it behind.  But always store the camera in this case to protect the viewscreen.  And be very aware to keep the lens over the flash clean.  Any "gunk" over this screen can be heated up by the flash to a permanent coating that will change the flash values.  And may I also add, the time from "power on" to first picture is very brief.  That's important to me.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad little camera!
Reviews.Author: Chris R. Field "christoph281"
Reviews.Content: Im used to shooting with a Nikon D40 DSLR.My wife wanted that nikon coolpix that ashton kutcher draws on with his finger as he runs around the party annoying everyone.the reviews were horrible, i searched for every touchscreen camera and almost got an ulser trying to select the right one for my wifes birthday. I wanted to get her the features she wanted, but i also wanted to make sure she wouldnt be disappointed with the images is captures.  With a handful of these touchscreen cameras on the market, the pickings are slim.Basically if you want DSLR quality you need a DSLR, if you wife wants a cute sexy slick little pink camera to throw in her purse and can be the source of almost endless entertinment, this camera nails it on the head 100%The pics are good. In daylight they are real good. In the garage playing beerpong at night with some friends they pics are somewhat grainy. But no more than any other P&S; camera.The touchscreen is not the same as an ipod, it is a little soft to the touch, but far far far more responsive than that piece of garbage cellphone called the Incite by LG.Not QUITE as good as Ipod Touch screens, but a very close 2nd and very usable.it has a lot of little neat features, you can make people smile if they werent smiling, you can give things a fish eye appearance, make things sparkle, you can draw on the screen and do all kinds of stuff with stamps, borders, etc..this camera pretty much embodies everything that a seasoned photographer despises about new cameras, but i have to admit this little gizmo is a lot of fun to play around with.Ill give it a full 5 out of 5 stars because while the image quality is not to my snobby DSLR user standard, it is 100% everything she was looking for, she absolutly loves it.

Reviews.Title: Very cool camera
Reviews.Author: ... "esizzle"
Reviews.Content: The pictures from this camera are very clear, and the touch screen is a nice feature. The one thing I would recommend is that you buy memory, as the internal memory in the camera is extremely low.The high resolution of the pictures take up a lot of space. This camera is very tiny so I could see how some people complained about the touch screen but I have normal sized fingers and got the hang of it quickly. The camera is slightly larger than a Motorola razor, is very thin and ultra portable, but it seems that a drop could demolish it. But all things aside I am very pleased with it. if you are looking for something that can take abuse try the Olympus stylus tough 8000 I hear that it can take abuse like a UFC fighter. The Sony how ever has excellent picture quality, and is very easy to use and carry around. I gave it four stars because it does not seem like it could survive abuse, so I would not recommend this for a child.  But if you would like a cool high resolution camera with a good lens and lots of little practical design features for under 300 dollars this is great.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Pammy
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing!! It's so small and thing, so easy to use as well. it's not complicated with all these buttons and what makes it easier is that this camera has automatic shooting...where if u went outside, it'd automatically go to "landscape" mode or to where ur taking a picture of one person only, it'd change to "portrait". I love it! It's easy to also switch to several megapixel sizes so you can load pictures easier on computer and the quality is the same no matter what the size is! Beautiful pictures and works beautifully without flash for video and pictures at night time. Colors are captured amazingly. Best camera Ive ever gotten. You wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: simply amazing!
Reviews.Author: T-mo customer
Reviews.Content: This a trully automatic camera! No need to fiddle with setting, just leave it on auto mode and you'll have great pictures!I got T90 instead of canon is780. Canon is780 was hard to turn on and the pictures were so so.What I like about t90:1. Movies are great, full HD, small in size and you can use optical zoom while shooting movies!!!2. Auto mode really does work on this camera. It detects the best settings for the shot PLUS it takes two pictures with two best possible settings!!! This is really handy when shooting with low light.3. Big lcd screen, love it!4.Picture quality is comparable to SLR cameras.5.The form of this camera makes it very easy and convenient to use. Very well made!

Reviews.Title: Best camera i've ever bought
Reviews.Author: Nihar Ajmera
Reviews.Content: I purchased the DSCT90/B last month and i'm still learning new things every time i use it. Its the smallest camera sony has ever made along with the T50 and T900 but it does wonders. I would rate 4 stars on indoor pictures but 5/5 on outdoors. The video quality is extremely good. I recently recorded a group of friends playing tennis and with the constant movement, the video turned out fantastic. The touch screen is also very good. Just need to clean the screen once in a while but other than that all the features are extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Michele Rustad "Shelly"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures in all kinds of light. The smile detector actually works! You don't even have to press the button. When it's set for smile detection you aim the camera and voila! The camera is small enough to fit in your purse and go everywhere with you. It also has a nice size viewing screen. The zoom is very easy to use because there's a button that moves back and forth, not like my old camera where you had to go to the menu to get the zoom. It takes a while to get used to all the functions of the touch screen, but once you learn, it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: Great photos, but bad construction
Reviews.Author: PMY
Reviews.Content: I have owned two of these cameras.  The photo quality is great and it has a sleek design but the touch-screen is so weak that it easily cracks.  My second one just cracked so I felt compelled to write a review. In this most recent case, the camera was just in my front jeans pocket and cracked due to the pressure from walking around (I don't wear tight jeans).I have other touch-screen devises (iphone, blackberry, etc.) and have never head a problem.  The screen on this camera feels different though; it flexes when you touch it.  Since most of the camera's controls are operated through the screen (as well as the viewfinder), when it's cracked the camera is basically worthless. Also, because you have to be so careful with it, you don't use it as much as you might other cameras.I will not be buying this camera again; I'll get one that has a more solid construction.Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Pocket Digi cam
Reviews.Author: Dipak
Reviews.Content: Excellent pocket digital cam. As I have already used Sony T10, I know how to handle T series digicams. Very slim and fits perfectly in pocket like a cellphone. Image clarity is excellent. 4x zoom is enough for such slim cam. Zoom in video recording is excellent. Auto mode is excellent as it detects sunlight, dark, macro mode, faces, smile detection. Overall worth to buy.Pros:Very slim, you can always carry in pocket without any problem.Can handle lots of GB memory (I have 8gig and I don't need to worry about space)Clearity is awesomeLook is very stylishCons:Need to use stylus for touch screen otherwise if you use fingers, you can see fingerprints on the screen.Don't use MicroSD to Duo Pro converter, otherwise everytime you start ur cam, it shows info msg, 'This memory card may not record..'If you want a camera for rough use, this T series is not for you as its delicateNo digital zoom

Reviews.Title: Camera surpassed my expectations
Reviews.Author: William J. Figie
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a new camera because my wife's old Canon Powershot had died (a 5 year old camera).  She gets all my hand-me-downs so I gave her my other Canon Elf camera.  This was a good camera but it had problems with the lense and its image stabilizing feature.  You see, I ride roller coasters and put camera in my pocket sometimes and it had a easy power on button and would try and extend the lense and not be able to so it would jam.  I had sent it back to the manufacturer twice in less then a year.  So I was kind of glad I had to buy a new camera.  I was thinking of the DSC-T900 but decided that the DSC-T90 was basically the same but cheaper (smaller display I think is all that is different for almost $100 more).  I am still learning all the capabilities of this camera but it really surpassed my expectations.  I like to take night shots of roller coasters and around amusement parks and it was GREAT at doing this when I set the ISO setting to max.  It was great and very easy to use.  Menus are very intuative.  Love that it protects the lense with the cover and no lense getting extended.  Plus it records video nicely and is 12.5 Mega Pixels.  I am totally happy.  I even showed a slideshow on the flat screen TV in my hotel room (including music supplied by the camera).  My only complaint is that I probably only get about 40 to 50 shots on a charge.  I also had a problem with the memory stick I purchased but I think it is a bad memory stick.  I would suggest getting a backup battery and alwsys download your photos ASAP to a desktop or laptop to protect them from getting screwed up in the camera.  I just love this camera so far.

Reviews.Title: Sony Rocks!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is the best digital camera I have ever owned! The best feature is the touch screen! I am able to use the sylus-type pen that came with it to edit my photos. I can crop my pictures and even right or draw on them. The screen is very crisp and clear with a great optical zoom feature. The camera takes great pictures and shoots awesome videos! I also love how the camera can be turned on or off by simply sliding the cover. The camera also comes with a rechargeable battery. This camera has turned many heads and gained a lot of attention. It's extremely functional while also being very fun!

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: N. Heinecke "heineken42"
Reviews.Content: I usually dont write reviews but I find them helpful.  I love Sony and this camera was a huge disappointment.  We are returning it because of poor picture quality.  We have DSC-H5 and love the pictures, but it is hard to carry around.  We wanted a compact camera that would still take good pictures.  Many of the pictures were blurry and often had a weird white light on them.  We tried adjusting the settings but the pictures poor in good light and poor light.  The worst were pictures at night or in a dim lite restaurant.  Try something else...

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: rjm
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera during the summer and i have to say i am truly impressed with the picture quality, i know there are a lot of 12.1mp cameras out there and many of them are cheaper but you will not get the same quality pictures! the lenses in this camera are what make it amazing! Also this camera is tiny! you can take it anywhere and the video it shoots is 720p!! and is truly high definition. Another thing that really sold me on this camera is how fast it starts up, you slide the front open and its ready to go in around a 1/2 second really nice feature.My one complaint about the camera is you have to remove the battery to charge it, kind of annoying but other than that its perfect!

Reviews.Title: Super ultra small digital camera
Reviews.Author: William Jackson
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our daughter for her birthday as she wanted something smaller than her old Canon DSC. This little camera is amazing. It is easily carried in a pocket and produces great photos and HD videos (720p). She loves this camera and as a photography enthusiast using Canon digital SLRs, I have been very impressed with it's performance. The touch screen menu system is intuitive, and works well. As long as you don't have a problem with using a Sony Memory Stick instead of a SD card, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: nice handy camera
Reviews.Author: Abhishek Goyal
Reviews.Content: camera is nice and very handy, but there is a lot of time lag between the time the photo is clicked and it actually shoots.

Reviews.Title: A good point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Mark Billings
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera after I had experienced disastrous results with an Olympus point and shoot camera (12 mega pixels at fine setting to get a halfway decent picture).Some people say that the menu on this camera is confusing or awkward.  I didn't really find that.  Once I had set my preferences, I have had no call to alter them since.  Pictures are very clear and sharp.  I did find the lens cover a little different to deal with at first, but now I am used to it.I cannot really comment upon how good or bad the battery life is as I have not really subjected it to sustained use, or, a long video session.I am not really a "photo buff" but this camera has exceeded my expectations in regard to quality and ease of use.  It does everything that I want it to do and more.  I just wish I had never wasted my money on the Olympus to begin with.The only con with this camera is that you really do need to purchase extra memory (but this is not confined to Sony; most camera makes are the same).  It arrives with enough memory to take a few pictures.  I already had compatible memory and once I installed it I was told that I had enough capacity to take 10,000 pictures at 3 mega pixels.  I haven't yet worked out how many battery charges will be needed to achieve that!Bottom line; I can't speak highly enough about this camera.  Most camera reviews in this class are mediocre at best and obviously you get what you pay for; but for a non-professional who wants a camera that takes good pictures in a variety of situations, then this is probably a camera worthy of further investigation.

Reviews.Title: Just got it
Reviews.Author: M. Case
Reviews.Content: I love it! However, I have two complaints. The first one is, I don't like the touch screen because finger prints show up immediately and they don't come off easily. The touch screen isn't sensitive so you really have to press hard on it & then it leaves this ugly finger print mark. So now I just use a hair pin to touch the screen. My second complaint is the camera seems sooo fragile. I use to have the old Sony cybershot & I compared the two in my hand, and the older one feels much more durable. I'm really nervous I am going to break this new one...let's see how long it lasts. I wish Sony would just make the cameras more durable.

Reviews.Title: T90
Reviews.Author: Gary Smoot "Pargolfernot"
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy my new camera with all it's features. I was looking for a good camera that was small enough to carry in my pocket, yet powerful enough to provide me with good quality and many good features. The Sony Cyber-shot has done just that.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful design, very slim, love the flip top, great pics
Reviews.Author: kwb75 "kb"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera.  I bought it to replace my older model Sony.  The design is impressive.  Its very slim, easy to fit in pocket or smaller size case.  Love the touch screen.  takes great photos so far, although I haven't had time yet to take a lot of them.  Also, I know a few other people that own this camera that love it too.

Reviews.Title: Terrible picture quality - shame on you Sony
Reviews.Author: Guille I.
Reviews.Content: I simply could not believe Sony would bring to the market a camera like this one. I've had many Sony products, including three digital cameras (from the 1997 Mavica to a 3MP and a 5MP Cyber-shot). This camera is very slim and convenient, the touch screen and the software are great. BUT, unless you simply want to show-off your camera, I'd rather keep my wife's old 3MP cyber shot. The indoor pictures were awful, and I know how to take pictures. The automatic mode gets lost with low light and shoots with 800 ISO, so the pictures are all grainy. Unless you set it manually, and you get a more decent picture. But still, I compared with the old 3MP (indoor and outdoor with a tripod) and the picture quality was much better with the old one.I'll not buying any more Sony. I switched to Canon (and looking at Amazon's rankings, it seems I am not alone)

Reviews.Title: Great point and click camera...  Good value.
Reviews.Author: C. WILLIAMS
Reviews.Content: I received this camera a few weeks ago and have enjoyed it ever since.  It was an upgrade from an older 7.1 MP Sony camera (DSC-P200).  This model is a tremendous improvement over my previous model.  I compared it to similar price level models from Canon and Nikon and found this models interface to be more user friendly, admittedly this could be due to my familiarity with Sony products.Pros:Great vibrant photosGood crisp images when not using zoomCompact yet sturdyTouch-ScreenNice displayGreat interface-I love that you can browse photos by date as it makes organization much more fluid and intuitive.Cons:Zoom is not on the level of other similarly priced models (though models with better zoom are bulkier-you have to pick your preference when selecting).Touch-Screen can be a little tedious, Sometimes the touch-screen will notrecognize or respond to my actions and I do not have large fingers/hands.  I would imagine someone with large hands/fingers could have a problem with the touch screen responding to a particular command when multiple options are present on screen.With all that said me and the Mrs. are very happy with the purchase.  Others who have used it have been impressed as well-her Aunt is actually talking about ordering one now.  It's great as a point and click camera and is compact enough to be carried effortlessly.  We are still wanting a DSLR camera, but this camera will hold us over until we make that transition--and even then, I know the DSLR will never be a full everyday carrier type of replacement!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera, few Drawbacks...
Reviews.Author: A. Ahn
Reviews.Content: So I've owned this camera for several months now and have taken thousands of pictures with it.  There's something about these Sony point-and-shoots that make for really attractive and colorful photos that are sharp and of a very high quality.  Oddly enough I find that the best pictures are taken in 5MP or 8MP mode.  The maximum (12 MP) gives the pictures a washed out sort of look.  I chose this camera primarily because it was so slim it could slip into your pocket and because it could take HD movies as well, and that it does!!!There are a few drawbacks, and that is that the battery life of this camera is not great, especially if you're shooting in video mode and the weather is somewhat cold.  I'm a huge outdoor enthusiasts and find that even with a spare battery I have to think twice about taking photos I want to take on multi-day treks.  I think the huge brightly lit LCD screen contributes to that a lot.  Another thing I found frustrating at times, but it's not too bad, is that you can't switch from picture to video mode in an instant.  Since it's touchscreen you have to pull up a menu and then switch.  Another thing is that low-light and night time photos look overexposed with the flash so I usually turn off the flash and try to keep it very still, but even so there's a lot of noise.The drawbacks, however, are overlooked considering the overall excellent pictures and video this thing takes.  I just have to find a way to charge the batteries with my solar charger and I'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: its cute little nice camara
Reviews.Author: S. Shah
Reviews.Content: I bought it as a to gift to my fiancee and It did it. nice compact body and really effective modes for specific conditions. I love the quality of video it records its really worth it. the only thing more i would like to have in this camera is longer battery life.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera, Just don't expect amazing quality shots.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to be a small point and shoot for my wife. Over all it is a great little pocket camera... except for the huge amount of digital smoothing done to compensate for the 12MP sensor.  Full res shots look almost bad there is so much smoothing to the images.HD video is pretty good, a little shaky, but not so bad that I want to buy a dedicated camcorder.If you want a pocket point and shoot for fun and you will be printing 3x5s this camera will be plenty good.  If you want crisp large format prints, or high-res digital versions look elsewhere because the full native res photos look really fuzzy.

Reviews.Title: Good Things Come in Small Packages
Reviews.Author: J. Davis
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, I've had it for almost a month now and have been very happy with it. I previously owned a Canon Powershot S2 IS, which was a great camera, but very bulky. I rarely took photos with it because it was a hassle to carry around. This Sony cyber shot T-90 is so small I can carry it in my purse or in a case and in my back pocket, it is comparable in size to my i-Phone.This camera takes great pictures in all types of lighting and landscapes. I recently went to White Sands in New Mexico and it captured all of my pictures beautifully even with the bright white sand reflection.Great buy!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY - 14 months old and it's already broken
Reviews.Author: Glen
Reviews.Content: First of all, very slow response time which causes a lot of blurred pictures. I learned to live with that problem but my real complaint is the fact that it got this  error E61:10. This message came out of the blue, we just turned it on one day and it had the message and stopped working.  I sent it to Sony's  repair service and after 2 weeks I got a letter via snail mail saying it will cost $182.29 to fix it. I could have bought a cheap camera for less then half the price had I known this one is only good for a year.

Reviews.Title: Cybershot went downhill with this one
Reviews.Author: Darcie Henry
Reviews.Content: I am so sorry to have purchased this camera.  I have had 2 of these in the past (older models) and even purchased versions for my parents in the past, however, this one with the touch screen is absolutely terrible.  The pictures are decent quality and the size is excellent however, the ability to take a photo and have it register or switch between photo and video is so slow and unresponsive that I miss many shots.  Any time you need to switch any setting, you can forget the next 5 photos that you were going to take (flash to no flash, etc).  I am sorry to see they made this camera ... it has always been a favorite and now, I suspect I will need to switch brands to be happy.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Elaine Bahns "Elaine"
Reviews.Content: I was so sick of buying camera after camera and being unsatisfied. Short term I was trying to buy an inexpensive camera, but got what I paid for.This camera is wonderful! I will get straight to the point in the future. Pictures turn out crisp and clear. You would swear I had a camera that is double the price.

Reviews.Title: Loved it
Reviews.Author: Sherri Jones "spidey789"
Reviews.Content: I liked the sleek black design. I didn't have to feel out of place whipping out a pink camera while wearing a military uniform. I didn't like how my purse pocket would turn it on by itself from my movement. Was bummed a couple of times with a dead battery and missed some vacation photos. I opted for charging fully two batteries so I could load a fresh one if that happened. The batteries are easy to charge and swap out. Euro power cables are available as an accessory purchase. I was able to find memory cards that took hundreds of photos, but a second memory stick would have come in handy in Rome and places that I really loved to take pictures. I am an avid scrapbooker and can easily take over 500 photos in a one week vacation. We got around it by downloading some photos onto a laptop for safekeeping, then wiping the memory card clean for another run of pictures. I loved how fast it came on, which came in handy when taking pictures of my terrier who never sat still. I could use video stills to create pictures of her because she was just toooooo fast for the lens. It takes video and can record alot. I was able to make this camera an integral part of my lifestyle. I am in love with this camera. With newer model designs it can only get better from here. Sony knows what they're doin'!!!

Reviews.Title: Whoa,it's amazing
Reviews.Author: D. Tran "Student"
Reviews.Content: When I bought it on September 6, 2009, it was $238.99. Now it is $259.99. I don't know why the price was increased. The pictures from this camera are very clear and nice; the touch screen is a nice feature. However the battery is not enough; therefore, I recommended people should have a secondary battery in order to back up. I also bought another battery from Amazon.The video quality is extremely good.

Reviews.Title: All that you need
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera for the price. Sony has put in everything that's needed for someone looking to own their first digital camera to more seasoned users. The "smile-shutter" option is great though I think it should and will become more intuitive as the years go by. The 12.1M pixel is huge and not really needed for any practical purpose. The looks are great and I am hoping the construction will last for the life of the camera (5 years??)

Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot T90 - Pink
Reviews.Author: Stephen F. Austin State University "Dawn"
Reviews.Content: If you want a camera that's small, simple, and easy...this is it! It takes great photos and has several different functions you can choose from. This a good little camera for people who love taking pictures. There's nothing extremely fancy about it, it's just a good quality camera for regular everyday picture taking.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Caberlon
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Almost equal to Sony T77 but with some extra functions. Small, light and easy to use. Pictures with great quality. I recommend.

Reviews.Title: A GREAT CAMERA !!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Randy S. Cress "rcbass"
Reviews.Content: Got this camera 2 days before i went on vacation out west. with little time to know the camera i was taking great pics from the start. this camera does more than i needed. being that it is so small , i had to get use to it. I took pictures out the window going down the highway at 70 mph and the camera adjusted ...no blur. i'm very happy with it..............RC

Reviews.Title: Great camera that has been living in a pocket of my jeans for more than year.
Reviews.Author: DMV
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for more than 1 year so far and I just LOVE IT. What a great backup for my DSLR camera that is bulky and not that easy to carry around everyday. This is point-n-shoot miracle created by Sony's engineers takes pretty decent pictures, I am just amazed how many nice functions are hidden within this tiny box.I have been in so many places around the US and Europe during the past year and this camera has traveled together with me in a pocket of my jeans all this time. Of course you cannot compare it with a DSLR but it does the right/great job! Hint: to keep touchscreen safe, always make it facing your leg while carrying in a pocket.P.S. DSC-T99 is another point-and-shoot camera from Sony that looks alike but $100 cheaper - please beware that these are absolutely different products. (I have recently purchased one as a gift and now returning it to the store; the bottom line is that DSC-T99 and DSC-T90 are not really comparable - DSC-T90 is way better).

Reviews.Title: The Best Point and Shoot Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: Karl Callwood
Reviews.Content: When my camera supplier first suggested I try the Sony Cybershot DSC-T90 as a still and video camera for my underwater shooting needs, I thought he had gone off his rocker.Here we have a credit card sized, ultra-slim camera that can literally fit in my wallet. Then, there is the underwater housing which is only the size of your average pocket camera."What can this midget do for me?" ran through my subconscious."Try it," he said. "Then bring me back some video so that I can do some store promotion."This was two years ago, he got his promotional DVD to show his customers and today I am still addicted to this tiny titan.Every weekday I shoot underwater videos and stills professionally as a SCUBA diver. I have used over two dozen cameras underwater of different company names and models. When I say that this is the best camera I have ever used for instant action underwater scenarios...believe me!It has the best automatic underwater white balancing for video and images that I have come across. Whatever magic Sony used, it accurately captures the vibrancy of underwater reds like no other. As any diver knows, the deeper you go, the less red is visible. This makes for interesting challenges as a manual red filter at 30 feet will not render the same red light recovery at 60, 90 or more feet under natural light conditions. (The underwater housing is good to a depth of 132 feet!) Changing filters underwater is impossible for most cameras and challenging, to say the least, for others. The 'Underwater Automatic White Balance' setting on the T90 seems to continually adapt to changing water conditions and renders reds as they should be.It can zoom while shooting video making for very intriguing, original and unique scenes and angles to grab and hold the viewers attention. I can zoom-in to tight frame on a subject, like the eye of a fish and zoom-out without stopping my recording to set the surrounding scene.How many cameras do you know of that can lock and hold focus on an object through 100 feet of water?The Sony Cybershot DSC-T90 can do it.It does so without focus wander or losing valuable time trying to lock on.Another great advantage of the T90's slim profile is that I can carry several spares in my diving vest's (BCD) pockets and still have room for other diving accessories.Why, you ask, would I want to have several cameras with me?There are a number of reasons. With two compact T90 cameras on a rack mount, I can shoot HD video (1080x720) with one while simultaneously taking 12.1 MP stills with the other. Using several cameras I can also film multiple angles at once. (You cannot shout "Cut" to a fish and retake the scene.) Should batteries run low (video is a power hog) or I fill up a flash card, I can grab another fully-charged camera without having to surface! (This is a big deal for SCUBA divers.) Additionally, (Heaven forbid) I make a mistake and flood a housing, I do not have to end my dive and lose picture sales for the day.Oh, yes...the camera gives me professional quality stills and videos by pressing just one button.Not having to fiddle around with a bunch of buttons and settings is crucial underwater. Fish are always in motion and scare easily to boot. If I do not have to fiddle with controls it means that I can capture a unique scene instantly. Plus, less hand and finger movement means that I am less likely to startle the fish.Did I mention that it is tiny? Very tiny. It is so tiny that fish rarely notice the camera. Anyone who has worked around fish know that they can get very uneasy about objects in a diver's hands. The bigger the object, the more likely a fish is to feel threatened. The T90 solves that problem by being almost unnoticeable. It is also small enough that it can be slipped inside crevices of coral without touching and damaging this delicate species.You may wonder about light handling capabilities. Have no fear. Even with such a tiny lens and aperture opening, this camera manages to have excellent light gathering ability. I have used it underwater on cloudy days and at night without dive lights to capture the subtle glow of plankton and other bio-luminescent life.The videos taken with this camera have allowed me to produce documentary DVDs, commercials and more. Post-editing videos to do color correction is an extremely time-consuming chore. I have rarely had to color correct T90 videos. With the sharpness of the imagery and the excellent contrast and color rendition, most people assume the videos were taken with a much larger and more expensive camera. They simply cannot believe me when I reach into my pocket and show them the T90.I totally recommend this powerhouse little tyke to anyone who ventures into Neptune's realm.

Reviews.Title: NOt what I thought it was.......
Reviews.Author: Cynanne
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in Dec, and now in March it is broken, I have been disappointed with the quality of the pictures that it takes and not the button that holds the battery in place is broken. I am hoping that I can return it for credit toward another brand camera. The tough screen is difficult to use and not very user friendly. The plus to the camera is that it is thin and small.

Reviews.Title: Cute but Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Sharon McCoy
Reviews.Content: Loved this tiny, little pink compact darling--and the pink leather case that is made for it, is fantastic (it screws into the tripod place_and it makes holding the camera easier.)  The Touch Screen is so easy to use you will get spoiled quickly.  So it killed me to that the image quality was so bad that I had to send it back. Indoor pictures with natural or indoor lighting haloed and ruined the images.  Outdoor was ok but the sharpness was not as good as my old Sony p200 or my husband's W290.  I wish Sony would get this camera improved so the images were good because all the other wonderful functions make this camera great. (and CUTE!)

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!!!
Reviews.Author: Betsey Johnson "Betsey"
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. I had an older version, lost it and had to get the same style. Love that it is slim, fits anywhere and takes amazing pictures! A must buy

Reviews.Title: The best brand
Reviews.Author: Dario Solis
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best camera I've owned.  Actually, I think it's also the best camera that I've seen so far.  I guess that's why I bought it.  The quality and zoom of the pictures are great.  Pretty much, just buy it and you'll see.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture quality
Reviews.Author: Miguel Contessi "Miguel"
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my niece and I am amazed with the quality of the pictures, specially when there is low light or even night time.  Like very much the features of the camera but the only sort of negative issue I have is the battery life which is not bad but it is not great.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Canterwood Crest fan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I liked the quality of photos in different lighting.  It takes great pics in the dark and inside without that dark background your usually find in other brands.  I love the auto features on this camera.  It automatically knows what type of lighting you are in need of without selecting anything.  It even fits in my pocket; I love the slim, compact design.  The only draw backs to the camera are the lack of zoom ability and taking action pictures (of course that could be contributed to the user..me).  Great value, especially through Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Cancelmi
Reviews.Content: This cybershot is one of the best that I've owned.  The extra large screen is great for seeing the subject before taking the picture.  Touch screen features are very user friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: felizma
Reviews.Content: This camera does not only have a very sleek design, but the quality and battery life are also amazing, too.I'm not good at writing review, so I'm going to make this brief.I'm a loyal Sony fan because of their innovation, product design and stable quality. Yes, many Sony products are a little pricy as compared to other brands, but the quality certainly worth the bucks. I have never (yes, I say never) have had a problem with all the Sony products that I own so far.Well, back to the camera, as expected, the camera looks amazing, or, even betther than the images here. The metalic blue really makes the camera looking cool. The camera is slim and easy to carry. It is not as light as I expected, but it is actually a good thing; because if it is light weight, it may look cheap, and considering the material that it is made of, it is not supposed to be light anyway.Although I had doubts about touch screen at the beginning, it actually works pretty good. I was afraid that sometimes touch screen may not respond well and instant, but it actually reponded well; however, I have to use the touch pen every time, so it takes 1 or 2 extra seconds to select options as compared to old camers that you may know exactly where the buttons are and able to press them even without looking at the camera. This would be my only complain, but hey, when I take pictures, I do not use the touch screen that often, besides switching from auto-flash and turning off the flash.The quality of photos are amazing. When I went on a trip with friends, many of them were like "wow, the pictures are really clear and beautiful" when they use my camera, so I assume that is a neutral party confirmation of the product quality?! lol. Overall, I am impressed with the camera. Oh, forgot to mention the smile shutter function, it is super sweet and super cute. It may not be very useful, but it works very well when pictures are taken indoor and in a close position to the camera (it seems that it is a little hard for the camera to recognize or focus on people's faces when the sunlight is too strong or the distance is too far). Although I do not have a big family or kids, I do think this is a useful function when there is a party held at a house, you know, whenever you take pictures of just people.Anyway, I recommend this product to everyone. By the way, the battery life certainly improves a lot as compared to the older model that I purchased a couple years before, and as compared to other brands as well.

Reviews.Title: Not Worth It
Reviews.Author: HappyCow
Reviews.Content: This review is coming from a person who has owned this device for a few years now doesn't know squat about cameras. I read so many reveiws from photographic know-it-alls ranting off about specs when all I want is dumbed down English that tells me if this device takes good pictures or not. So for people like me I'll do just that in my review.Back in the day, I would've considered this to be a decent point-and-shoot (aka an I-don't-know-anything-about-cameras kind of camera) but these days not so much. The quality of the images are nice, the touch screen is great and it's very easy to use. Close-up STILL targets come out quite beautiful.On the downside, the largest disappointing feature is the Zoom function. 4x is NOTHING if you hope to capture moments from a distance (ie graduations, stage events, weddings in a big church). It also doesn't shoot very well at night. So don't take it to Las Vegas and expect to get a good picture of city lights or to a concert and expect to get any good closeups or facial features of whoever is playing. Motion images can be a problem no matter what you do so forget trying to take a clear picture of little Johnny on the soccer field.As for the camera itself, it's a sleek design with subtle contours that make holding onto easier but not bulky in your pocket. I've never had problems with the components breaking but I have accidently turned it on a few times when the cover slips. The battery life is weak. It drains even when the camera isn't on and the battery is out, so buy spares. Always keep one sitting in the charger ready to go. A fresh battery will last you a couple hours.Overall, I suggest spending a little more and getting a newer point-and-shoot model. For this price you can find something worth your money and with more features to play with. Remember, higher Zoom numbers means you can narrow in on things better from a distance (at the time of this review, numbers in the upper teens and beyond are worth your dollar). Higher megapixels refer to the quality of the image you get and this matters if you don't want to post fuzzy photos on the internet or even plan to fix them up in Photoshop later. Higher everything is better (except price of course).

Reviews.Title: Least Favorite Point and Shoot - EVER
Reviews.Author: Linzey Zoccola
Reviews.Content: I am so exhausted with messing with the settings to attempt to get a decent indoor photo.  I have had this camera since 2009 and wish I would have taken it back for exchange immediately.  This camera is getting a one star rating from me because of this list of pros / consPros:the slide cover keeps the shutter completely safelarge view screen has held up great (i'm in a wheelchair and have dropped it a lot, no issues)Cons:extremely terrible battery life, even when off battery loses charge in a few days! 3 minutes of video kills battery, and one event of photo taking battery dies before event ends!FEW quick snap is clear indoor or outdoor - I have to take 25-35 shots to get 1-3 CLEAR photos - I continually change settings and take photos in each setting but it changes NOTHINGNO indoor (or low light) photos come out well.Over all, I just hate the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good until it stopped working
Reviews.Author: A. Leedom
Reviews.Content: Like some others rating this camera negatively, I liked it until out of the blue, the screen stopped working - rendering it worthless.  Fortunately for me, it was 13 months after I purchased it. :)  Now, being 1 month past the warranty period, the minimum repair charge on the camera is $125 - over 50% of the cost of the camera.  Not going to do it, and not buying a Sony again.

Reviews.Title: Screen started showing multi colored
Reviews.Author: Rony G. Koruth "Online Shopper"
Reviews.Content: The camera was working fine for nearly a year after that the screen went mulicolored. After that tried removing battery and puttingthe battery still when we switch on the camera the screen still shows multicolored. No picture can be seen or taken now with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Best christmas gift EVER :) <3 <3 <3 <3
Reviews.Author: Zakkiyyah
Reviews.Content: This camera is absolutely the best, I was somewhat mad that I couldn't get the pink one but once I turned this camera on it didn't even matter anymore. I took a simple picture of my eye, and it was the clearest thing my little eyes have ever seen. I was very happy, it was SUPER clear. It looked kinda like a Crate & Barrel Advertisement. Once I saw how great it took pictures I stared to take more pictures of things that you would see in a magazine, and it was also EXTREMELY great. This camera is actually pretty easy to use and you get the hang of it after a while, and the many different modes make it easier to take pictures for the different settings. For example I selected the firework scene when I went downtown for New Years, I took so many great pictures with this camera, I just love it. As a matter of fact I didn't know I had so many split ends until the day I bought this camera :P, this picture is like a professional camera but so small. I was kinda scared when I saw how small it was, but after a while you appreciate the size because it can fit it into your pocket. I'm actually gonna upload some pics i took with it so people can see :)

Reviews.Title: Great camera, good video quality
Reviews.Author: Eva Wagner
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for Christmas last year and have used it a lot. The pictures come out very nicely and it has a macro setting to get very close-up subjects.I have never had a problem with this camera so far, but I will say that my husband is a drummer and the crash of a cymbal has a weird effect on the sound. The bass drums come through well and videos upload onto youtube as HQ, but that weird cymbal noise is the only complaint I have.I have the Kodak EasyShare V610 Kodak EasyShare V610 6MP Digital Camera with 10x Dual-Lens Optical Zoom also, and while that one takes better quality sound recordings, this one is better in all the other ways. The touch screen CAN get a little frustrating, but after you get used to it, it's better.Overall, I would recommend this product for someone looking for a great high-quality camera who is NOT recording drum videos. :)

Reviews.Title: the best camera EVER
Reviews.Author: Amanda Khaloo
Reviews.Content: love it... the best camera i ever bought. the pictures come out really clear, everytime. and the autosetting features works extremely well too. LOVE my camera =]

Reviews.Title: Amazing -Like. No. Other.
Reviews.Author: Faith "LFK"
Reviews.Content: I purchased it through here, I read all information about it even rated from those people who purchased too. I was a little bit doubt because my oldest sony cybershot was good, not the best but unfortunately it was stolen. I got casio exilim, i did like it but it was really not my type. So I finally made a decision and i did purchase it here.:) I got it today and i loved it already. That Sony Cyber-shot T90 is the number six of all in all digital cameras report. No wondering, it is totally like no other. Its all POSITIVE. Negative is not there as I looked around it. You should purchase and play with it. you would say the same :)

Reviews.Title: Smart, Sexy, Super and Useful
Reviews.Author: Mukthiar Gani "Gani"
Reviews.Content: This Little cam of Sony is a real sexy piece. The output of the camera is excellent. I fell in love with the design but after using iam just crazy about it. One thing to note is that the touch screen menu is less user friendly. Every other aspect is cool. Its surely a big value for money.Place your orders folks :)

Reviews.Title: Can't read 16GB Memory Stick Pro Duo
Reviews.Author: C. kurma "Ck"
Reviews.Content: Everything is good with this Camera except for not being able to read 16GB Sony Memory Stick Pro Duo. It reads max up to 8GB. Whereas Sony says it is supposed to read upto 32GB. I tried Cameras from Amazon and both had the same problem

Reviews.Title: very easy to use and great pictures and videos
Reviews.Author: sue "sue"
Reviews.Content: I love it. I just had it for a couple of weeks. It is very easy to use, just put it on auto mode and leave the rest for the camera to do.I am impresed how clear the pictures and videos are.

Reviews.Title: Sony Camera
Reviews.Author: A. Bendel
Reviews.Content: As this was my first sony camera, I really wasn't sure what I was going to get. The camera had some good reviews, but none from any users. I have to say that I am very happy with the camera. I takes some great pictures although the pictures are quite large in size, about 5mb if you use full 12 mpx capacity. The video us very clear and the software that came along to convert the HD the video is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Bryan S.
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a month or so now and I am very happy with it.  The picture quality is great and it is well built.  It is a much nicer camera than my friends more expensive Canon.  I would recommend it to anyone looking for a small camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor Images, Good HD video and USability
Reviews.Author: J. Mewada "Janak"
Reviews.Content: I have previously used Power shot as well Cyber shot both.This one i have selected because i do not want to carry a camcode as well camera on a trip or any function.Also what i wnated is small size, 10MP+ and HD video. So there are 2-3 contender, one is from Nikon as well.I checked out all models in retail store and finally ordered this one.Pros:- Very good design, weigh and fetures packed.- Very usable and simple UI.- Touchscreen is really good, and works like charm.- HD video capture is really good feture.- Startup time is very fast, less then 2 seconds. Just slide the cover and it's on. It's one of the fastest camera i have seen.Cons:- The main thing for which you purchase a Camera is to capture a still image, which it does very poorly.- Images is are sooo grainy no matter where you capture outdor or indoor.- It can only capture 72DPI images, that is the one reason image quality is so poor.- Don't dare to take print outs of indoor shot images.. too poor to print.- Battery life is soo much poor when it comes to Video capture. If you take more then 3 to 5 minutes continues video you can litterly see that battery is draining.- 4x Zoom is very poor, and if you go with smart zoom(with software) it will kill you image.Reason i have not retunred is my wife like it very much, as she can carry it in pocker and can quickly take video of our baby who has just started crawling. She likes easyness to capture video, instead of a camcoder.

Reviews.Title: Best point & shoot i've ever used.
Reviews.Author: Ralph "O RALPH"
Reviews.Content: Great Camera, lots of functionality and customizations... AMAZING photo quality for a point & shoot

Reviews.Title: intelligent scene recognition-hated it!!!!
Reviews.Author: Pamela Morris
Reviews.Content: I like the portability of this camera and have owned nothing but sony cameras.  I decided to get this camera for travel so that i dont look like a tourist with the larger sony that i have that i use for real estate photos.  Well i absolutely hate the intelligent scene recognition on this camera because you cannot turn it off!!!!!!!! For example, in a dim dinner setting you cannot turn the flash on or adjust the exposure to lighten the picture because the camera wants to automatically use the twilight setting which makes the photos come out very dark.  If i had realized that this feature could not be disabled i would have never purchased the camera-its too late to take it back.  Needless to say, i will be looking for another camera and it may be another brand....

Reviews.Title: Short or Long Battery Life?
Reviews.Author: K. Hashem
Reviews.Content: Most of the new digital cameras from SONY are infamous for thier battery consumption. Yet I got used to it. I always leave home with two fully charged batteries just in case I might need it. But if you're going to take less than a few hundred pictures, just one fully charged battery should be enough. But still, stay on the safe side and get an extra battery.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased.
Reviews.Author: Trenton Kuehn
Reviews.Content: I had not owned a camera in a long time and am quite happy with this one.  It has multiple picture functions and the camera auto selects the right one for you based on your surroundings and subject, which is awesome, since I know as much about photography as I do aerospace engineering (zilch).  I highly recommend this product to both newbies and photo geeks since it is super-easy to use and takes great pics.

Reviews.Title: Clear pics
Reviews.Author: S. Wade
Reviews.Content: Love my Sony cybershot... takes phenomenal pictures. Results are very crisp and clear pictures and easy to use too. Also very durable, I've had this camera for years now and it's still going like new.

Reviews.Title: I recommend this product
Reviews.Author: Victor
Reviews.Content: I choose this rating, because the camera works excellentLooks very stylish.My friends recommended this product to me, and I really love itI recommend this product to everyone

Reviews.Title: The best;)
Reviews.Author: Flyestaurus
Reviews.Content: This item was stolen from me in new condition over 3 years ago. I've been watching this item for over a year...FINALLY I went ahead and purchased it as 1 of the lifts off my back. Happily ever after. The seller was great with shipping and answering my questions. EXACTLY what I expected overall;)

Reviews.Title: Got this as a feasible replacement for my father
Reviews.Author: Semih
Reviews.Content: He keeps breaking, losing. ruining cameras as an inspector and instead of spending 300 a pop I found these affordable and suitable replacements. He's happy with it I'd like to buy a dozen more at this price.

Reviews.Title: Not great
Reviews.Author: K2112
Reviews.Content: I guess it's not bad as a slim pocket camera, but there's not much that it does great.  I have been especially disappointed with its ability to take photos in low light.  I don't even bother with the flash as it almost never catches the image without a blur and the color isn't great.  Action shots are also pretty bad.  I know low lighting is a problem with a lot of cameras, but this one doesn't improve matters at all.  There must be better cameras on the market than this one.

Reviews.Title: My Old Baby
Reviews.Author: Erica Quinones
Reviews.Content: I miss and use to love this camera. I made the mistake of bringing it into the beach and getting suntan lotion on the touch screen part but all in all it still worked great. My best friend now has my camera and it works great after all these years. I would buy this camera all over again if something didn't give me a new one as a birthday present.

Reviews.Title: Loved
Reviews.Author: MELISSA
Reviews.Content: I loved this cute little camera and brought it on all of our trips until i got ocean water in it.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Quality.
Reviews.Author: Ululani "Ululani"
Reviews.Content: Even though this was not the camera I originally used to own, I like it almost as much. The picture quality is great and there are multiple settings. Hopefully the touch screen on this one won't be as easily broken as the last.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera!
Reviews.Author: Elena
Reviews.Content: I had a very similar Sony camera which I bought in 2003, loved it, and would probably still be using it if it had not been stolen from me on a recent trip to Europe... so I wanted a replacement. This camera is excellent for my purposes - light, compact, smart, easy to use, and best of all - it takes superb pictures, even on AUTOMATIC setting, which makes my son and my husband (who have far more sophisticated cameras) jealous. The touch screen is definitely an improvement compared to the old model. So far I have taken pictures outdoors (botanical garden, nature walks) in different lighting, and they all come out sharp, focused and vibrant with color. Thank you, Sony!

Reviews.Title: Great I guess
Reviews.Author: R. Pena
Reviews.Content: I bought it for a friend and she has not given me complaints to date and I think she's had it for about 2 years or more.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber Shot's a winner!
Reviews.Author: T. Fink "mambajam"
Reviews.Content: I've owned 3 of these cameras.  Unfortunately, two of them fell into the water (my fault) on canoe trips. I did manage to retrieve the 1st camera, but it didn't work very well because of the water damage. I lost the second one in a lake to never be found again.I loved the Sonys' so much because of their quality, that I wanted another one.  This time I won't be taking it out on the water unless I have the waterproof cover on it.Let me tell you, they're very easy to use, and I love the touch screen!  I've gotten so many compliments on my photos!-Very crisp and clear. Oh, and I also want to add that I just happened to keep my first camera that fell in the river. I had it in storage for a year. Got it out a few months ago, and guess what!  It's working!!! You can't go wrong with this one :)

Reviews.Title: Short Battery Life
Reviews.Author: frankcutronijr
Reviews.Content: The camera is nice and compact, but the battery has a short life.  Order another battery would be the best idea.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot
Reviews.Author: Kim Coleman
Reviews.Content: this was purchased as an insurance settlement I have actually used this and it is very nice takes very good pictures

Reviews.Title: Love this
Reviews.Author: Inga "I wish you happiness"
Reviews.Content: This is a easy to use camera. I love it looks and quality. Suitable for people like me, who doesn't know much about technology

Reviews.Title: Best Camera ever.
Reviews.Author: H
Reviews.Content: THis is the best Cybershot camera I have ever own. The design is nice, it takes great pictures, great video, it has many cool features like the capability of writing on the pictures or the smile function. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for Christmas and she has yet to put it down since. She is not a techie, and even though you can get lost in some menus, she quickly has found the features she enjoys the most and uses them. Be on the lookout for my wife as no matter what function we are at, I always see her pulling it out on guests unexpectedly :)

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE battery life!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_F
Reviews.Content: I was very happy to receive my Sony camera and start taking great photos but after only a few months the battery would barely hold a charge.  After about 10 months it didn't hold a charge AT ALL.  Very disappointed with this sony product.  It is a nice camera but beware of battery life.  I will return to Canon or Nikon for my future camera purchases.  Definitely not with the $$.

Reviews.Title: Sony Camera
Reviews.Author: Donna B
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased to replace one just like it that had been stolen so I knew what it was like.  The only thing was that the wrong owner's manual was sent with it and the box was a little tattered but all the parts and pieces were included that was necessary to operate the camera.

Reviews.Title: SONY CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Simply Dolling ""movie Lover""
Reviews.Content: THIS LITTLE CAMERA IS REALLY GREAT.  IT HAS ALL KINDS OF FEATURES (MORE THAN I WILL EVER USE...PROBABLY) ON A TOUCH SCREEN,,,IT COMES WITH A STYLUS AND TOOK SOME GETTING USED TO...BUT I LOVE THE SIZE AND WEAR IR ON A LANYARN AROUND MY NECK, SO THAT I WONT LOSE IT OR DROP IT,,,

Reviews.Title: Great picture and HD video
Reviews.Author: Sharad Mahat
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera from Sony. Being able to shoot video in 720p is awesome. Photo comes out great too with up to 12Mp resolution. I use it with 2Gb memory stick and it has decent battery life. Takes about 3 hours to fully charge the battery but usually lasts for at least a week for us.

Reviews.Title: All You'll Ever Want and Need....
Reviews.Author: Sabbakwa
Reviews.Content: This camera is all that I ever want and needed. It was nice, I had to buy it twice. Actually, my first one was stolen and living without it was miserable so needed to make a 2nd purchase right away (this time filling out registration and fulfilling my warranty).Picture quality is great and very easy to use. Battery dies quickly but it doesn't take long at all to charge.Can't live without it.

Reviews.Title: RIP dear camera... After only 6 months of very light use..
Reviews.Author: Ana
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera only 6 months ago. It was terrific! Beautiful pictures, very portable, adorable design, love the touch screen and all the features! I didn't even use it that much, carefully carried it around on a vacation and a couple of family reunions. Now, 6 months after I had this, the touch screen just all of a sudden went pitch black! Teh camera trurns on, you can take pictures, zoom, anything, but you cannot see a thing on the screen... I contacted local sony support (I live outside the US), and they say the screen is done and needs replacing. I never dropped the camera, never handled it roughly, it doesn't even have a scratch, it looks new! I can only wonder how come the screen went dark if i didn't drop it...Tech guys tell me that repairing it will cost TWO HUNDRED DOLLARS!! (which by the way is only 25$ short of what I paid, as I got it on sale, and half of what it costs now)...So disappointing, how can it be dead after almost no use and only 6 months!!! I was also told that the warranty may not cover this.

Reviews.Title: simply the best
Reviews.Author: Sean Kane
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th non SLR digital camera, i have had it for about 12 months now, and i have to say that it is by far the best camera that I, or anyone I know, has had. The punchline is simple. It is TINY, fits in my pocket like a cell phone (please remember not to have anything else in your pocket because the touchscreen WILL scratch), fast, and i haven't had to take it off AUTO to get the best pictures. Of course fooling around with black & white, sepia, and vibrant is fun, but 99% of the time, I leave it on auto and the pictures come out GREAT. This camera has a great quality of capturing backround light and creating a great picture by mixing the light sources together. Mind you i'm not a professional photographer, but if you were, you wouldn't be buying a non SLR camera anyway. The bottom line is that whenever i am at a party, my camera takes the best pictures compared to anyone elses pocket size digital camera, every time, PERIOD. And to the reviewer who complained of a "haze in every picture that would make carl zeiss roll over in his grave", clean your lens!

Reviews.Title: Portable camera but priced too high for this kind of quality.
Reviews.Author: Black Philosophy "Black Philosophy"
Reviews.Content: Granted this camera is portable and has some technology that beats my previous camera, the Exilim, I feel for the price it was when I bought this a year ago and STILL is over priced for the quality. The two problems with this camera were 1.) Battery Life and 2.) Power On/Off Button. Maybe i'm not use to the touch screen idea of battery life, but when on vacation I noticed that I would have to recharge my battery atleast twice a day if I were to use consistently for a few hours. I'm kind of okay with that if there's a power outlet around to charge it! The next thing that makes me completely frustrated which also has effect on the first problem is the Power On/Off button. If you have the camera in the Sony camera case or if it's in your pocket (of course you don't want to simply put it in your pocket without covering in case it gets scratched or you bump into something that will dent it - it appears like a delicate camera), you run the chance of accidentally turning it on, which in my case would ALWAYS turn on when I tried to tuck it in my pocket. Then there were times I forgot when I turned it on, because I was on vacation more focused on touring different places, and wanted to take a picture and the camera would already read 'Low Battery.' It makes me frustrated to find a camera not usable when you've spent time charging it for a specific event. Those are two problems one should check out before this camera.However, the Positives of this camera, besides the portability, is the shutter speed, high quality movie and photo, editing of photos on camera, and other functions that make this camera somewhat a keeper.I just still get angered to see that I have to walk around with not only a camera case, but also a charger!

Reviews.Title: I love the form factor!
Reviews.Author: ReviewerDave
Reviews.Content: I replaced my Sony DSLR with this because I rarely used the BIG DSLR camera. I wanted an ultra portable camera with great features without the hassle of "preparing" the camera for every shot I took. I love this camera for a lot of reasons: touch screen to configure and navigate, zoom lens works great without an actual lens that zooms in and out from the camera body, great build, super portable, and great battery life. There is a setting for almost anything you could think of. I wanted to have a camera that I could just pull it out and it would be able to auto adjust to ANY environment. That said, this camera takes great pictures, mostly outdoor pictures. With everything set to "Auto", outside pictures are great! Inside pictures, which normally need flash, are the worst I have ever seen from a Sony digital camera. Granted, I could get it to take good inside pictures if I made adjustments in various settings. But I wanted the Intelligent Auto exposure setting to do this for me. It just so happens to do that better when pics are taken outdoors rather than indoors.Also worth mentioning is video. I have taken a few videos and they turned out great! It records in 720p HD and the resolution and sound is great!So I gave it 4 stars, but I would have given it 3 1/2 stars. Many shots I take are indoors, probably more than 50%. Most of those pictures are ok when viewed on a PC screen or TV that is set to view the picture to fit the screen. But if you view them in 100% resolution, they are usually very grainy and "distorted" looking.I think my next point and shoot camera will be a Nikon or Canon.

Reviews.Title: A good camera
Reviews.Author: Hussein
Reviews.Content: A good camera. I've had multiple Olympus cameras and this is my first Sony camera. It is easy to use the camera and it's quite portable, but the pictures are mediocre

Reviews.Title: nice cam. bed software
Reviews.Author: pen
Reviews.Content: i love my camera without poor battery and bed software. only think is bed in the camera i record 3 videos each 5 minutes and battery died. i was in voccation 4 hours drive and may be never gonna have the change to see that naturel place again. what ever. i took couple pix and videos. came home. my computer didn't show the videos. okay i installed the PMB which is suckest software i have ever seen. this PMB came with the camera in same box. i try to upload videos online, loses quality. and no way to fix it. i paid for hd camera but i upload videos in very poor condition like 5 years old cell phone camera record. i try to save records to the my computer same thing happend. very low quality. i also needed to some change and add on video it is inpossible in this PMB. i wanna use my movie maker software, PMB dont accept it. can some body tell me what tha hell is that

Reviews.Title: Quick and small - the only way you'll have it when you need it
Reviews.Author: MussSyke
Reviews.Content: As a guy with only four pockets, I can't stand to carry something bigger than this.  This is as small of a decent camera as I could find at the time.  Besides that, the quality is fantastic.My favourite part is that you can turn it on, snap pictures, and have it back in your pocket while most other people are still waiting for their lenses to extend.Everything else has been said many times, so I'll leave it at that for now.

Reviews.Title: Good pics quality
Reviews.Author: Loughborough
Reviews.Content: It has a good pics quality and portability. Battery life is quite good enough. I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Sony
Reviews.Author: Roxy Mc "Roxy Mc"
Reviews.Content: Nice camera tiny easy to fit any small pocket, good quality pics!The blue color is pretty.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jackeline Tellez "chata"
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything on it's own! I always hated having to try and figure out what kind of setting to put on my previous cameras so that the picture would come out the best... after a while I would just put it on "auto" and hope for the best.  This camera detects it's surroundings and will adjust to whatever environment you are in automatically! It will detech backlight and eliminate it and also detect if it's a portrait picture, landscape, etc.  Plus it looks so slick and small enough to put in a clutch purse or pocket.  People ask me how much I paid for this like it must have costed so much money so it even looks expensive!  I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Anti-shake doesn't work!
Reviews.Author: J. Kim
Reviews.Content: Got this for Christmas and the pictures are blurry!  The anti-shake obviously doesn't work.  It's not like I'm vigorously shaking the camera!  Not sure why, but all I can assume is that the anti-shake is not doing its job.

Reviews.Title: Best pocket camera I have ever owned!!!
Reviews.Author: Sara "Sara"
Reviews.Content: This camera is by far the best camera I have ever owned. I am ***shocked*** by the pictures I take with the flash. Instead of washing the photo out, it is crisp and clear and bright. Some of the first pictures I took were of my dog in my apartment at night. And there is no way you could tell it was dark in that room!The touch screen was a concern for about 30 seconds. I was unsure how I would feel about it. But once you know where all of the settings are, switching back and forth from flash to no flash, from picture to video, from regular to macro (up close), etc is so easy and possible to do with one hand. The touch screen is now the best part of this camera in my opinion. It comes with this little plastic pen that attaches to the wrist cord. If I'm editing the pictures or seriously messing with the settings I can use the pen, but if I'm just making small adjustments while shooting, a finger tip does very well.The volume could be a little louder on the camera during playback. But once you upload the videos to a computer, the sounds isnt a problem.Make sure you get a case for this camera though. You dont want to risk messing up the huge screen!

Reviews.Title: Fun camera
Reviews.Author: eil
Reviews.Content: I use this for still and video.  Wish I could zoom while recording video, but not that big a deal.  I bought a refurbished.  Seems to work very well.  Read the manual thoroughly to understand this camera, it has a lot of features.

Reviews.Title: FABULOUS!!!
Reviews.Author: R. O'Hara "Mamacita"
Reviews.Content: This Sony Cybershot is a fabulous camera. I love the smile capture feature!!! I can't say enough good things about it!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!!! Best There is!
Reviews.Author: fairsoul85
Reviews.Content: this camera is awesome. I love it. it takes great pictures. so many different things you can do. buy it. you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding pocket camera
Reviews.Author: M. T. McNeight
Reviews.Content: The ease of use - touch screen, etc. - the picture quality and the pocket sized form factor make this an outstanding 12 MP, ready to shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Throw your old staff (camera & video) away
Reviews.Author: Victor "VIC"
Reviews.Content: Well built, compact size, fits in your shirt pocket picture quality is excellent and the 720p HD video quality is absolutely great for this small gadget. I am selling my previous video camcorder 'cause this one does it all. Battery life - even with no brand name product - gives you 150 pics and/or 30-40 min video.

Reviews.Title: All It's Cracked Up To Be
Reviews.Author: Orangeman "Orangeman"
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the picture taker on the go.The size makes it easy to take with.The camera turns on and sets up quickly so you capture the moment- not the moment after THE MOMENT.The viewing screen is large and clear. The touch screen is easy to use to make adjustments.A bonus is the videos we took were surprisingly crisp and clear.I am not a photographer nor a tech head. I like to capture the moment, download and email the photos and move on.This camera works well for someone like me.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Ilona Norwood
Reviews.Content: It was a great gift for my mom, she can take it everywhere she goes with her frinds, it became her small toy...

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-T90
Reviews.Author: K. Letteney
Reviews.Content: I am pretty happy with this product. The pictures are great, the battery lasts longer than any camera I've ever had before, and it is easy to adjust the settings (or just point and shoot if you want). The touch screen is nice for picking the spot to focus on, but I worry about scratching or breaking it. Overall, a fun and easy to use camera that takes great pictures and videos

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jose R. Nebro
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera, definitely worth the money, has a ton of features which makes it easy to use.  I bought the camera for my daughter and she loves it.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever!!
Reviews.Author: John Keck
Reviews.Content: This is Johns wife and I LOVE my new pink camera...it is so cute and compact. I bought a pink leather case and I carry it in my purse so I always have it with me. The pictures are fantastic! I love the iauto feature that senses the lighting and scene  and picks everything for you so you always take great pictures. It's amazing how well it takes pictures in dark lighting...instead of focusing on just the subject and making everything around them black...it gets the WHOLE picture..background and everything...it's amazing. I totally recommend this baby...buy it and and you will be so happy.

Reviews.Title: DSCT90
Reviews.Author: Camera Coffee
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera! The video is truly awesome quality. And you can record a good bit on it! Definitely great picture quality too. The screen is great. The metal on it looks really cool. Very sleek. Very light. I did have a problem with them not giving me a usb cable to easily transfer my pics. I would have used my card reader but the Sony dcst90 uses a Memory stick pro duo which is a much too small in size for my SD/MMC -MS/PRO card reader in my Dell Inspiron laptop . So i just have to buy a usb cable. BUT I DEFINETLY think this camera is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera to Go Everywhere
